results.title: Measure of care: Alligator Rivers region
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
Following an environmental impact study by Mr Justice Fox, the Australian Government set up the Office of the Supervising Scientist to carry out scientific research in the Alligator River region of Kakadu National Park to establish base-line figures which would enable scientists to monitor the mining activities. This documentary deals in some detail with this research, and discusses the problems associated with mining in such an unusual and beautiful part of Kakadu National Park. Narrated by Robyn Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Impact of mining
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
The second film in a series looking at the work of the Supervising Scientist following the Fox Report on Uranium mining in the Kakadu National Park region of the Northern Territory. To monitor possible problems, scientific studies were carried out before work began. Shows some of the field work and by the use of interviews examines possible problems which could occur.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: Water safety
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Although our main beaches are well patrolled by lifesavers, it is in the rivers and creeks, where we must rely on ourselves, that many drownings occur. The film shows many ways in which we can help ourselves in an emergency and suggests precautions to take before swimming in unknown places. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Snowy Mountain Scheme
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
This short film shows the early stages of the Hydro Electric Scheme. Illustrating the difficulties in development and construction through diagrammatic animation. This film was probably shot and completed before the scheme was finished.

results.title: Our wheat industry
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Peter Whitchurch Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A survey of the Australian wheat industry, its early history and its importance to the national economy. Shows the early attempts by Farrer to produce a rust-resistant wheat; the type of wheat developed by Farrer for cultivation in the dry inland areas; the importance and extent of the present day wheat industry; problems confronting the wheat farmer; transport and storage of wheat; the manufacture of flour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Whitchurch, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Peter Whitchurch Productions

results.title: Methods of water rescue
results.creator_credit: Maria Boldini, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A team of schoolboys demonstrate, both on land and in the water, methods of rescue, release and resuscitation. Shows methods of rescue for calm and struggling patients; release from the clutch of a panic-stricken patient; rescue methods for an unconscious patient; resuscitation by the Schaeffer methods; restoration of blood circulation by massage of the limbs. The film concludes with demonstration of a number of fancy swimming strokes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Boldini, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Mechanised farming
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Illustrates the use of many types of equipment now available to farmers to assist in the production of food for use both in Australia and for export to other countries. Equipment demonstrated includes different types of tractors, ploughs, cultivators, seed drills, ditch-digging equipment, harvesting machines, mechanical and hand spraying equipment for dusting crops and orchards, post-hole borers and power drills for building fences, small bulldozers and so on. Commentary by John Lorimer.

results.title: Learning to swim: the crawl stroke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Demonstrates the simplest of all swimming styles, the crawl. Shows how to develop confidence, buoyancy, correct leg and arm action, correct breathing and co-ordination for the full movement.
